soundTherapy.title: Sound Therapy & Frequency Healing
soundTherapy.description: Experience therapeutic frequencies and binaural beats to promote deep relaxation, reduce anxiety, and enhance focus through scientifically-backed sound therapy.

playingState.description: Allow the healing vibrations to wash over you. Focus on your breath and let the frequencies guide you into deep relaxation.
playingState.instructions: Close your eyes and allow the vibrations to penetrate deeply, bringing peace to your mind and body.

howItWorks.title: How Sound Therapy Works
howItWorks.description1: Sound therapy uses specific frequencies and binaural beats to directly influence your brain's electrical activity. When you listen to two slightly different tones in each ear, your brain creates a third 'phantom' frequency—the binaural beat—that can guide your brainwaves into states of deep relaxation, focus, or calm.
howItWorks.description2: Different frequencies resonate with different parts of your nervous system. Theta waves (4-8 Hz) promote meditation and anxiety relief, while alpha waves (8-12 Hz) enhance relaxed alertness. The pure tones also create sympathetic vibrations in your body's tissues, promoting physical relaxation alongside mental calm.
howItWorks.description3: With consistent use, sound therapy can help retrain your nervous system's baseline state, making it easier to access calm even without the audio. Research shows these effects are measurable in brain scans, heart rate variability, and stress hormone levels.

brainwaveEntrainment.title: Brainwave Entrainment
brainwaveEntrainment.description: Your brain synchronizes with external rhythmic stimuli, guiding electrical activity into therapeutic patterns.

autonomicBalance.title: Autonomic Balance
autonomicBalance.description: Specific frequencies activate the parasympathetic nervous system, lowering heart rate and reducing cortisol production.

physiologicalResonance.title: Physiological Resonance
physiologicalResonance.description: Sound vibrations create subtle physical effects throughout your body, releasing muscle tension and promoting circulation.

science.title: The Science Behind Sound Therapy
science.description: Sound therapy is backed by rigorous clinical research demonstrating measurable reductions in anxiety, stress, and physiological tension. A study of 62 participants showed Tibetan singing bowl meditation lowered anxiety scores by 0.67 points overall and 0.89 points in beginners, with tension decreasing by 1.12 points. Multiple trials confirm sound-based interventions produce consistent, measurable benefits.

proceduralAnxiety.title: Procedural Anxiety Reduction
proceduralAnxiety.description: In 112 patients undergoing bronchoscopy, binaural beat audio reduced anxiety scores by 7.26 points and lowered systolic blood pressure by 9.89 mmHg—significantly outperforming music or no intervention.

thetaBeatsAddiction.title: Theta Beats for Co-Occurring Anxiety
thetaBeatsAddiction.description: Eight 20-minute sessions of 7.5 Hz theta binaural beats in 30 opioid-dependent men reduced anxiety inventory scores from 27.47 to 10.00—a 64% improvement with large effect size (η²=0.949).

emergencyStaff.title: Stress Relief in High-Pressure Settings
emergencyStaff.description: Among 54 emergency nurses during COVID-19, 15 minutes of 432 Hz music lowered median anxiety scores from 34 to 29, decreased respiratory rate by 2.7 breaths/min, and reduced systolic BP by 3.8 mmHg.

whenToPractice.title: When To Practice
items: When feeling overwhelmed, anxious, or unable to settle your mind
Before medical procedures, stressful events, or important conversations to calm your nervous system
During acute anxiety or panic episodes to interrupt the stress response
At bedtime to promote deep relaxation and prepare for restorative sleep

whatYoullNotice.title: What You'll Notice
items: Immediate calming effect within the first 1-2 minutes as your nervous system begins to respond
Slower heart rate, deeper breathing, and reduced muscle tension throughout your body
Enhanced mental clarity and emotional distance from anxious thoughts
Cumulative resilience with regular practice—your baseline stress level gradually lowers over time

headphones.title: Headphones
headphones.description: Use stereo headphones for binaural beats to work properly. Each ear must hear a distinct frequency.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: Find a quiet, comfortable space where you won't be interrupted. Dim lighting or closed eyes enhance focus on the sounds.

consistency.title: Consistency
consistency.description: Practice 10-20 minutes daily for best results. Brainwave entrainment becomes more effective with regular exposure.
